triples.name: Evolutionary game theory
triples.relevance: The paper applies evolutionary game theory concepts to analyze spatial games on lattices and their dynamical behaviors.

triples.name: Normal-form game
triples.relevance: The payoff matrix is the standard representation used in normal-form games to define game parameters.

triples.name: Bifurcation theory
triples.relevance: The paper investigates bifurcation phenomena that occur in the evolutionary game dynamical systems as parameters change.

triples.name: Topological conjugacy
triples.relevance: The paper classifies systems into 14 topological conjugacy classes to identify which systems have equivalent dynamics.

triples.name: Symbolic dynamics
triples.relevance: The paper examines symbolic dynamics of the evolutionary games to characterize their chaotic properties.

triples.name: Chicken (game)
triples.relevance: The snowdrift game is a variant of the chicken game studied in the context of spatial evolutionary dynamics.

triples.name: Topological entropy
triples.relevance: The paper derives nonzero topological entropy as a measure of the complexity and chaotic characteristics of the systems.

triples.name: Homeomorphism
triples.relevance: The paper uses two homeomorphisms to establish topological conjugacy classes among the evolutionary game systems.

triples.name: Lattice (order)
triples.relevance: The paper studies evolutionary games on a one-dimensional regular lattice as the spatial structure for interaction.

triples.name: Chaos theory
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes chaotic characteristics of the systems including topological entropy and mixing properties.

triples.name: Dimensionality reduction
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an effective dimensionality reduction method based on addition and scalar multiplication invariance to classify payoff matrix parameters.
